page.description: The SYS_EVENT_LOG() function logs events into the Windows NT system log. Under NT based systems, log events to the system log - event messages format has optional <Flag>: prefix where <Flag> is E=error,W=Warning,I=Info,S=Success,F=Failure. other options - E=<event#>,C=<Category#>

argument.name: event
argument.description:
The event message. There is an optional prefix in the format :, where can be:
"E" = error
"W" = warning
"I" = information
"S" = success
"F" = failure

page.example: sys_event_log("Alpha Anywhere Application Server","I:The server has started")
